etymology.description: 无 ‘without’ + 脑 ‘brain’ = lacking brains → foolish; dim.
etymology.interpretation: Colloquial pejorative for acting without thinking or lacking judgment, common in internet slang. Often appears in set phrases like 无脑粉/无脑黑 for mindless fans/haters.
etymology.simplification: Both characters were simplified: 无 adopts an older cursive/ancient variant of 無; 腦 was streamlined to 脑 to reduce strokes in the phonetic component; pronunciation and meaning stayed the same.

examples.chinese: 他这种无脑的跟风太可笑了(他這種無腦的跟風太可笑了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhè zhǒng wú nǎo de gēnfēng tài kěxiào le.

examples.chinese: 别做无脑投资，要先研究风险(別做無腦投資，要先研究風險)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zuò wú nǎo tóuzī, yào xiān yánjiū fēngxiǎn.
examples.english: Don't make brainless investments; study the risks first.

examples.chinese: 网上有些无脑黑只会喷人(網上有些無腦黑只會噴人)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎngshàng yǒu xiē wú nǎo hēi zhǐ huì pēn rén.
examples.english: Online, some mindless haters only know how to attack people.
